intro: Echites marginatus, commonly known as the marginate echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite, ovate leaves with toothed margins. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
